summary: This document appears to be a screenshot or report of social media analytics related to a tweet from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) concerning the unsealed indictment of Jeffrey Epstein. It shows the tweet's high engagement and impressions, and lists public figures who engaged with it. It also contains contact information for victims or informants.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the unsealed indictment referenced in the SDNY's public tweet, for which the document is reporting social media analytics.

persons.name: Lenny Dykstra
persons.context: Former NY Mets baseball player listed as one of the most popular engagements with the SDNY's tweet about the Epstein indictment.

persons.name: Harry Shearer
persons.context: Actor/comedian (The Simpsons, Spinal Tap) listed as one of the most popular engagements with the SDNY's tweet about the Epstein indictment.

persons.name: Ann Coulter
persons.context: Political commentator listed as one of the most popular engagements with the SDNY's tweet about the Epstein indictment.

persons.name: Nicholas Besse
persons.context: Public Affairs official for the U.S. Department of Justice, U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, whose contact information is provided in the document.

connections.description: Besse, as a DOJ public affairs officer, is involved in the public communication regarding the indictment and investigation of Epstein.

events.title: Unsealing of Epstein Indictment
events.description: The indictment against Jeffrey Epstein was unsealed by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, prompting a public call for victims and information.

keyFacts: A public tweet from the SDNY regarding the Jeffrey Epstein indictment earned over 3.1 million impressions in a short period, indicating massive public interest.
The tweet included a call for victims of Jeffrey Epstein or individuals with information about the alleged conduct to contact the FBI.
High-profile engagements with the tweet came from figures like Lenny Dykstra, Harry Shearer, and Ann Coulter.
The document provides official DOJ contact information (Nicholas Besse) for the Epstein case press office.
The analytics report shows the tweet was part of a broader public outreach effort by federal prosecutors following the unsealing of the indictment.
